scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
PDF/A is included in 3 national catalogues of recommended specifications. They belong to Estonia, Spain and Sweden. The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of these Member States is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets. 

National catalogue Estonia: 
https://www.mkm.ee/sites/default/files/interoperability-framework_2011.doc

National catalogue Spain:
https://administracionelectronica.gob.es/pae_Home/pae_Estrategias/pae_Interoperabilidad_Inicio/pae_Normas_tecnicas_de_interoperabilidad.html#CATALOGOESTANDARES

National catalogue Sweden:
https://www.avropa.se/globalassets/dokument/open-it-standards.pdf?_t_id=1B2M2Y8AsgTpgAmY7PhCfg%3d%3d&_t_q=standards&_t_tags=language%3asv%2csiteid%3a95d515a5-23ca-47bf-87a9-07b10d8ac360&_t_ip=178.139.72.144&_t_hit.id=Avropa_Core_Models_Media_GenericMedia/_ff07d720-f793-44b0-994d-27e79b28f6bd&_t_hit.pos=7

NIFO factsheets:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
As a document format, PDF/A helps to make data available on the internet. This fact demonstrates that the standard is supporting the first level of maturity from Tim Berners-Lee's 5-star schema for Open data.  

PDF/A reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html
https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:   
https://5stardata.info/es/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specificationÂ
statement:
ISO has defined a clear procedure to develop its standards. It consists in a 6-steps process where everyone who is interested can participate. However, if you want to participate, you have to contact your national standards body and you have to be approved for joining the Technical committee (TC) who will develop the standard. ISO has defined the roadmap of standards, it is composed of 6 steps as before said. For the approval of a standard the two-thirds majority of P-members of TC is needed. If the result is negative, the document is returned to TC/SC to be further studied.

The ISO standardization process: 
https://www.iso.org/stages-and-resources-for-standards-development.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
As defined on the TC standardisation, only TC members are involved in the development of ISO standards. A review is carried out to arrange the consensus firstly within the TC members and subsequently is reviewed by the different ISO member bodies. However, it cannot be considered a public review, because only TC members can participate.

The ISO standardization process: 
https://www.iso.org/stages-and-resources-for-standards-development.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification is available for everyone to study.
statement:
The ISO 19005-1:2005 and ISO 19005-2:2011 which refer to PDF/A-1 and PDF/A-2 are not available for free for everyone to study. Payment is needed to reach access to the standard.

PDF/A reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html
https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
There are no disclosures of ISO IPR Database to identify the licensing under the specification. ISO 19005-1:2005 (PDF/A-1) and ISO 19005-2:2011 (PDF/A-2) are not listed in ISO/IEC/ITU Common Patent policy, so it cannot be confirmed that the specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis.

ISO patents:
https://www.iso.org/iso-standards-and-patents.html 

ISO standards and patents IPR database:
http://isotc.iso.org/livelink/livelink/13622347/Patents_database.xls?func=doc.Fetch&nodeId=13622347

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The ISO specifications are published to be able to respond to a market need which represent a consensus of an expert group. In 2005 PDF/A was published which specifies how to use the Portable Document Format (PDF) 1.4 for long-term preservation of electronic documents. These facts demonstrate the maturity and market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services. 

PDF/A reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html
https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
PDF/A is highly adopted as a document format for exchange information, which is technological independent. These facts demonstrate the maturity and market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services. 

PDF/A reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html
https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
At the moment of performing the assessment, PDF/A is widely used in across sector manner. One of the main document format used for the document exchange between different parties, and to ensure the availability of documents' content over the time. A clear example of this are public administrations and the high usage of PDF as a document format to exchange information. However, it cannot be considered as an asset to build innovative solutions. 

PDF/A reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html
https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

statement:
PDF/A has the ISO community that supports the development of: International standards, Technical Specifications, Technical Report and Publicly Available Specification.

The ISO standardization process:
http://www.isotc292online.org/projects/iso-process/

criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
As a document exchange format, PDF/A is a valuable tool for sharing information through the internet. Allowing sharing data and information the standard foster the visibility of administration data and services. Additionally, it eases the decision-making process within administrations. 

PDF/A reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html
https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is independent of any specific technology and/or platform.
statement: The main objective of the Portable Document Format/A (PDF/A) is to allow text format and images to be independent and work for any software, hardware or operating system. So it can be said that PDF/A is independent of any specific technology or platform.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement: The adoption of PDF/A as a document format for exchanging information does not hamper the scalability of systems. It is a widely adopted and used for this purpose and, moreover, it is independent of any platform or software. Therefore, PDF/A is proportionate to the users' needs and at the same time, it does not hamper the interoperability and scalability of systems.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement: The main objective of the Portable Document Format/A (PDF/A) is to allow text format and images to be independent and work for any software, hardware, or operating system while transferring. Additionally, PDF/A is widely used by administrations to share their information and data. Fostering the availability of data and information, it fosters the data portability using documents. Moreover, the PDF/A includes features that impact positively the preservation of the information contained in this format. It is an extended method to ensure the availability of digital information over time.

https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

The standard provides security features that foster the trustworthy data exchange between administration and stakeholders. PDF/A protects in itself data integrity, but also provides capabilities to protect with passwords and user roles the access to the document. 

PDF/A reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html
https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
By allowing the exchange of digital documents, PDF/A avoids sharing non-digital documents and then helps to the reduction of administrative burden. Additionally, as a format fostering the preservation of digital information, ensures the possible reuse and exchange of data over time. 

PDF/A reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html
https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

PDF/A is designed for this purpose. It is an Electronic document file format for long-term preservation of data.

https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html

statement: After carrying out information retrieval, no document or study has been found assessing the PDF/A in terms of efficiency or effectiveness.

criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
PDF/A is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, PDF/A can define the interoperability aspects of the "e-Archiving Component" and "e-Archiving Service" ABBs of the EIRA Technical Infrastructure View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

PDF/A validators:
https://www.pdf-online.com/osa/validate.aspx
https://www.pdf-tools.com/pdf20/en/products/pdf-converter-validation/pdf-validator

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidences have been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
PDF/A has been assessed previously by the Netherlands using the Technical scenario which is fully aligned with the European Standardisation Regulation 1025/2012. As the result of the assessment is positive, PDF/A can be considered compliant with the European regulation. 

PDF/A in JoinUp: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/solution/camss-assessment-pdf-a2-scenario-2

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of PDF/A is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

PDF/A reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html
https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
The purpose of PDF/A is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

PDF/A reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html
https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
PDF/A does not define a cross-sector reusable data model, but defines a file format for representing electronic documents. 

PDF/A reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html
https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
Although PDF/A supports the first level of maturity from the Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for the Open data, it is not supporting the main principles for the publication of data as Linked Open Data. 

PDF/A reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/38920.html
https://www.iso.org/standard/50655.html

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
